title: Sunrise in the Land of Milk and Honey
text:
Sunrise in the Land of Milk and Honey is <a href="Cracker%20%28band%29">Cracker</a>'s eighth studio <a href="album">album</a>. It was released on May 5, 2009 on <a href="429%20Records">429 Records</a>. It is the final album to feature longtime drummer Frank Funaro and is notable for the contributions of many guest artists such as <a href="Adam%20Duritz">Adam Duritz</a>, <a href="Patterson%20Hood">Patterson Hood</a> and <a href="John%20Doe%20%28Musician%29">John Doe</a>.
The song "Darling One" was originally released on the self-titled 1996 album by <a href="Susanna%20Hoffs%20%28album%29">Susanna Hoffs</a>. It was co-written with former Cracker member <a href="Davey%20Faragher">Davey Faragher</a> in addition to Hoffs and <a href="David%20Lowery%20%28musician%29">David Lowery</a>. "Friends" was originally released on Johnny Hickman's 2005 solo album "Palmhenge". "Hey Bret (You Know What Time It Is)" refers to Brett Netson of <a href="Built%20To%20Spill">Built To Spill</a>
Personnel.
The following people contributed to "Sunrise in the Land of Milk and Honey".
